reportincident-report-btn-label: The text for the report button.
reportincident-dialog-close-btn:
The tooltip text for the close button on the Report Incident dialog
{{Identical|Close}}
reportincident-dialog-back-btn:
The text for the button to move back from the form submission step to the information step in the Reporting dialog.
{{Identical|Back}}
reportincident-dialog-submit-btn:
The text for the button to submit a report.
{{Identical|Submit}}
reportincident-dialog-harassment-type-la: Label for multiple choice field that allows the user to specify what inappropriate behavior has occurred.
reportincident-dialog-additional-details: Label for additional details input on report form
Placeholder text for additional details input on report form
reportincident-dialog-optional-label: Text used to indicate that a field is optional on the report form with parentheses wrapping the word.
reportincident-dialog-violator-label: Label for who is being reported input on report form
reportincident-dialog-violator-disclaime: Additional help text shown for the field where a user enters the user they are reporting
reportincident-dialog-violator-placehold: Placeholder text for the field where a user enters the user they are reporting.
reportincident-dialog-harassment-type-ha: Label for type of harassment: Hate speech or discrimination
reportincident-dialog-harassment-type-se: Label for type of harassment: Sexual harassment
reportincident-dialog-harassment-type-th: Label for type of harassment: Threats of violence
reportincident-dialog-harassment-type-in: Label for type of harassment: Intimidation, aggression, name calling
reportincident-dialog-harassment-type-so: Label for type of harassment: Something else. If selected a extra box appears for the user to enter free text to describe the something else.
reportincident-dialog-something-else-inp: Placeholder text for the 'Something else' text input that is shown when a user has selected the 'Something else' harassment type.
reportincident-dialog-unacceptable-behav: Banner shown in the dialog used for reporting a user due to unacceptable behaviour.
reportincident-dialog-get-support-title: Title shown in the last step of the non-emergency flow, which shows info about how to get support from the community.
reportincident-dialog-record-for-statist: Footer message shown in the dialog used for reporting a user due to unacceptable behaviour.
reportincident-dialog-harassment-empty: Error message shown to the user when they have not selected one of the items in the behavior list.
reportincident-dialog-violator-empty: Error message shown to the user when they have not specified the user they are reporting.
reportincident-dialog-something-else-emp: Error message shown to the user when they have not specified anything in the 'Something else' textbox.
reportincident-dialog-violator-nonexiste: Error message shown to the user when they have entered a username that does not exist in the reported username field.
reportincident-dialog-internet-disconnec: Error message shown to the user when they attempt to submit the form but their internet is disconnected.
reportincident-dialog-server-error: Error message shown to the user when they attempt to submit the form but the server has an error (status code of 5XX).
reportincident-dialog-generic-error: Error message shown to the user when they attempt to submit the form but the submission fails and no other specific message is defined.
reportincident-unable-to-send: Error message sent back via the REST API if creating an incident report fails.
reportincident-email-subject:
Email subject line for reports sent to moderators. Parameters:
* $1 - the username of the user who filed the report.
reportincident-email-body:
Email body for reports sent to moderators. Parameters:
* $1 - The username of the user who filed the report.
* $2 - the username of the user being reported.
* $3 - One of the following messages:
** {{msg-mw|reportincident-email-link-to-comment-prefix}}
** {{msg-mw|reportincident-email-link-to-topic-prefix}}
** {{msg-mw|reportincident-email-link-to-page-prefix}}
* $4 - The link to the revision of the page at the time the report was filed, optionally linking to a specific comment or section heading.
* $5 - a comma-separated list of behaviors defined in the form.
* $6 - additional text supplied by the reporter
* $7 - a link to Special:EmailUser for the user with username in $1
reportincident-email-link-to-page-prefix: Text used to prefix a link to the page that associated with the report in {{msg-mw|Reportincident-email-body}}.
reportincident-email-link-to-comment-pre: Text used to prefix a link the reported comment in {{msg-mw|Reportincident-email-body}}.
reportincident-email-link-to-topic-prefi: Text used to prefix a link the reported topic in {{msg-mw|Reportincident-email-body}}.
reportincident-email-something-else:
Value of the freetext "something else" list in an emailed report to moderators.
Parameters:
* $1 - The text supplied by the user in the "something else" field.
reportincident-emaildialog-title: Title to show in dialog when user does not have a verified email address
reportincident-emaildialog-close-button: Text to show in button label to close dialog, when user does not have a verified email address.
reportincident-emaildialog-content: Text to show in content region of a dialog shown when user does not have a verified email addres.
reportincident-emaildialog-primary: Text to show in button label for primary action in dialog shown when user does not have a verified email address.
reportincident-confirmedemail-required: Message to show in API response when user submits an API request without a confirmed email.
reportincident-dialog-describe-the-incid: Text to show in dialog header when describing an incident.
reportincident-dialog-report-immediate-h: Title set for the incident report dialog when the "Immediate threat of physical harm" reporting option was selected
reportincident-type-of-incident: Text to show above radio buttons that present user with a list of options for defining the type of incident.
reportincident-type-unacceptable-user-be: Text to show for the "unacceptable user behavior" option for an incident report type.
reportincident-type-immediate-threat-phy: Text to show for the "immediate threat of physical harm" option for an incident report type.
Description text for the "immediate threat of physical harm" option.
reportincident-choose-option: Text to show in a select menu prompting the user to pick an option
reportincident-dialog-cancel: Text to show in a button that will close the dialog
reportincident-dialog-continue: Text to show in a button that will advance to the next screen in the dialog
reportincident-unacceptable-behavior-foo: Text to show in a footer of the incident report dialog
reportincident-physical-harm-infotext: Notice text displayed when the user selects the "immediate threat of physical harm" report type.
reportincident-physical-harm-footer: Text to show in a footer of the incident report dialog
reportincident-threats-physical-harm: An option to show in a sub-menu of the incident report dialog
reportincident-threats-self-harm: An option to show in a sub-menu of the incident report dialog
reportincident-threats-public-harm: An option to show in a sub-menu of the incident report dialog
reportincident-type-incident-required: An error message shown if the user did not select a type of incident
reportincident-behavior-required: An error message shown if the user did not select a type of unacceptable behavior
reportincident-threat-harm-required: An error message show if the user did not specify a type of harm
reportincident-submit-emergency-dialog-t: Title of the incident report dialog set after a report has been successfully submitted
reportincident-submit-emergency-success: Success message shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report with the "immediate threat of physical harm" type
reportincident-submit-emergency-section-: Section header for informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
List item with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
List item with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
Section header for informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
Paragraph with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
Paragraph with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
Paragraph with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
reportincident-submit-behavior-dialog-ti: Title of the incident report dialog set after a report with the "unacceptable user behavior" type has been successfully submitted.
reportincident-submit-behavior-notice: Message shown in the incident report dialog when reaching the last screen for the "unacceptable user behavior" type.
reportincident-submit-behavior-section-s: Section header for informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
Paragraph with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
List item with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.

List item with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report. Parameters:
* $1 - title of a local wiki page used for dispute resolution.

List item with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report. Parameters:
* $1 - title of a local wiki page used for reporting urgent issues.
List item with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
List item with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
reportincident-submit-behavior-section-o: Section header for informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.

Paragraph with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report. Parameters:
* $1 - title of a local wiki page used for general questions.
Paragraph with informational text shown in the incident report dialog after successfully submitting a report.
reportincident-submit-back-to-page:
Label used for the primary button on the incident report dialog. Parameters:
* $1 - the title of the current page.
